title: Font for "FlipSides" and "Pretzel"
content:
Hi does anyone know the font type for "FlipSides" and "Pretzel"?

Thanks,

Eric

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130923012424im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1_5248.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130923012424im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1_6655.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130923012424im_/http:/typophile.com/files/2_5755.png)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130923012424im_/http:/typophile.com/files/2_6660.png)
author: Lightswitch

comments.content:
It must be **[Cronos Pro (Bold Display Italic)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130923012424/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Adobe&ffam=Cronos%20Pro%20-%20Bold%20Display%20Italic&fstyle=&fsize=60&fid=6c896409fc6663cd90688330d21e3474&wrap=2&text=FliPSideS%20Pretzel)** by Robert Slimbach (1996-2001\*)

EDIT: (\*) Design Date
Wow! Slimbach only lived to be five years old? And he created so many fonts in such a short time! We should all be so productive.
Yes, he was a genius... a font's Mozart :)
